movies.title: The Silence Within
movies.plot: The defense minister of an unnamed European country is murdered. But there is a witness...
movies.simplePlot: The defense minister of an unnamed European country is murdered. But there is a witness...

biography.bio: Pascal Ulli's first appearance on a big screen was 1996 in "Nacht der Gaukler" as Klaus Koska. For this performance he was nominated with 15 other young European actors as Star of Tomorrow at the 9th International Film Festival in Geneva.... and he won the audience award as best promising European actor. Pascal Ulli speaks English, German and French fluently. He was born 1969 in Bern, Switzerland. After graduating from college he was trained in New York, USA at the renowned H.-B. Studio under the direction of Uta Hagen. There he got in touch with the American art of acting and he decided to devote all his inspiration and energy to Method Acting. Ulli was founder and producer of the OFFOFF Bühne (winner of the Impulse-Preis '98), and he is producer of Independent Theater Produktionen and spielplatzfilme . Ulli has worked for over 15 years as actor, producer and director. He played in over 30 films - mainly as leading actor - and he can be seen regularly on stages in Switzerland. Pascal Ulli is married to Caroline Ulli and has two children: Maxim and Manon.
biography.name: Pascal Ulli

biography.bio: Ingrid Sattes started classic ballet at the age of four. At 14 she switched to ballroom dancing, and four years later to Modern and African dance, studying with Yessica Ivanson and Ismael Ivo. Ingrid Sattes is also a musician. She studied guitar for 8 years, and she was a founding member of the Recrash W avantgarde-pop group from 1991-95, where she played keyboards. In 1994 the group released their CD 'Helluvatime'. Besides that, Ingrid Sattes studied psychology and finished with a doctor's degree. In 1992 she took acting classes in Zurich and Berlin, and two years later co-founded the Off-Off-Bühne Zurich, soon one of the most interesting and most awarded free theater groups in German-tongue theater. The Off-Off-Bühne was open to cinematic concepts, and so it happened that Ingrid Sattes made her first notable appearance on film with her Off-Off-colleagues, playing the leads in 'Nacht der Gaukler' and 'Dr. Younami's Couch'. In the past two years she shifted her focus to appearance in TV films and serials, but continues to work for the stage.
biography.name: Ingrid Sattes

biography.bio: Hans-Peter Ulli is an actor, known for The Silence Within (1996), Das Deckelbad - Die Geschichte der Katharina Walser (2015) and Champions (2009).
biography.name: Hans-Peter Ulli

biography.bio: Thomas Martin is an actor, known for The Silence Within (1996).
biography.name: Thomas Martin

biography.bio: Péter Palátsik is an assistant director and director, known for Push and Pull (2003), Ez nem Sacramento (1995) and Living and Learning (1992).
biography.name: Péter Palátsik

biography.bio: Alexander Seibt was born in Frankfurt/Main, grew up in Zurich, and received his acting lessons in Lucerne and Moscow. During the last decade he worked with numerous film and theater directors, e.g. Daniel Schmidt, Claude Chabrol, Samir, and Igor Bauersima. Together with Bauersima, Pascal Ulli, and Ingrid Sattes, he founded the Off-Off Theatre Group in Zurich in 1994. This collaboration soon turned out tremendously creative and successful, producing and staging the plays 'Die Pflicht', 'Glücklich zu sein', 'Mixed', 'Forever Godard', 'Context', and others. In 1998 the group received the main award of the Impulse Festival (Germany's main festival for the presentation of free theater productions) for Igor Bauersima's 'Forever Godard', and they were again invited with 'Context' in 1999. In 1996 Alexander co-starred Pascal Ulli in the movie 'Nacht der Gaukler' (Night of the Clowns), which soon reached fame among insiders, and in the short film 'Dr. Younami's couch' by Igor Bauersima, which was invited to Locarno, Melbourne, and the Slamdance Festival in Parc City. Alexander is co-author of and plays lead in M. Alvarez 'Bevor es dunkel wird' (1999), and he was repeatedly awarded for this achievement, namely as Best Actor at the Court Ficcion Film Festival 2001 in Barcelona, as Best Male Actor and for the Best Script at the Medina del Campo.
biography.name: Alexander Seibt

biography.bio: Ingold Wildenauer was born in 1938 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for L'homme à tout faire (1976), Der Berg (1990) and Strähl (2004). He died on April 27, 2013 in Zürich, Switzerland.
biography.name: Ingold Wildenauer
